job.description: I was in charge of staffing new restaurant locations, as well as supervising contractors at the construction sites to ensure that the building and equipment met the necessary requirements to run the store optimally once they opened.
I primarily focused on hiring and training staff members to assist in the opening of several new locations during my time with Freddy’s.

I was responsible for scheduling installation appointments, directing installations, and providing any necessary service to the security systems for customers. I also assisted in inventory at our warehouse, would provide support to other technicians on installations and services when necessary, and insured that all their installations were done properly.

I assisted in managing customer accounts, retention of current customers, resolving customer issues, insuring high quality customer service, and auditing to ensure accuracy, consistency of information on accounts, and accuracy of metrics measured by the company.

I played a key role in the training and development of all of our employees and ensuring that our restaurant was as successful as possible. I was responsible for management of inventory and financial security, as well as oversight of the stores general operations. My store won several awards during my time there and I was often called upon to travel the other stores that were considered “problem children” by the company for periods of several weeks to resolve issues and give instruction for the management and crew to prevent further issues.

school.name: Utah Valley University
school.description: I’m currently about half way through the Bachelor of Computer Science program at UVU and have always been fascinated by computers. When I was in 7th grade I taught myself HTML, CSS and JavaScript, and by the end of high school I was contributing to open source projects on GitHub. I’ve been using Node.js since the 0.4.x branch when it was still just Ryan Dahl’s side project. I remember when they still used the old cloud logo and I know the API like the back of my hand. More recently I’ve also learned Python and C++.
